Program

Goals:

  1. To facilitate R programmers in applying their skills to analyze Astrostatistics data that are publicly available

  2. To present the Astrostatistics projects at R-Ladies Chicago meetup

Program Planning:

  1. Introduce the ASG initiative and recruit members to sign up (minimum of a 3 people required)

  2. Check the lists of Astrostatistics projects and data:
    • List of projects (from solar activity, galaxy redshift to exoplanets)
    • Data list for Astrostatistics projects
    • Data list for Exoplanets from Caltech, Open Exoplanet Catalogue, exoplanet.eu, exoplanets.org
    • List of CRAN packages in R for Astronomy
    • VOStat: a simple statistical web-service that lets you analyse your data without the hassle of downloading or installing any software

  3. Start a project, finish it in 2-3 months period, and present the result at R-Ladies Chicago meetup

  4. Collaborate (in the form of study group/mentoring/sponsporship) with:
    • Open NASA
    • Adler Planetarium, Chicago
    • Society of Physics/Astronomy Students in Chicago
  5. Join Astrostatistics communities:
    • Astrostatistics on Facebook
    • AstroInformatics on Facebook
  6. Attend conferences:
    • International Astrostatistics Association meetings and events
    • Statistical Challenges in 21st Century Cosmology
